description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ὑδατίς (hudatís, “watery vesicle”).

entries.meaning: A cyst due to infection by larvae of some species of the tapeworm Echinococcus.
examples: Your sacred Majesty, he has the dropsy;—We shall find pints of hydatids in’s liver,He has not half an inch of wholesome fatUpon his carious ribs—
